definition: an instant (Sanskrit: ksana)/split second/the twinkling of an eye
Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 剎多羅, Sanskrit ksetra)
that/those/then (in that case)/commonly pr. [nei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing

sentences.english: With love at first sight, our hearts are linked, changing the moment into eternal love.
sentences.chinese: 只是一见钟情，两颗心已相通，刹那化成永恒情浓。

sentences.english: For a moment a flaming ring was raised high up on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 刹那间，一个熊熊燃烧的火圈被高高地支了起来。

sentences.english: And in shart measures life may perfect be.
At the moment of death, our state of mind is all-important.
sentences.chinese: 在死亡的那一刹那，我们的心境非常非常重要。

sentences.english: Let her smile at the moment between the solidification?
sentences.chinese: 让她的笑容在刹那之间凝固？

sentences.english: For one instant, he believed that these words had passed his lips.
sentences.chinese: 在一刹那间，他相信这些话确实已经说出了口。

sentences.english: Although it appears just a very brief time, it can leave people permanent impresion.
sentences.chinese: 它产生在一刹那，但却给人留下永久的记忆。

sentences.english: Anyway, it was pretty Christmasy all of a sudden.
sentences.chinese: 不管怎样，刹那间，四周已是一片圣诞景象。

sentences.english: Love like sugar, I bolt, enjoy the moment sweet illusion.
sentences.chinese: 爱似糖衣，我囫囵吞下，享受刹那甜蜜的错觉。

sentences.english: My life-long wait for your moment of gazing does not come.
sentences.chinese: 我终生的等候，换不来你刹那的凝眸。

sentences.english: At the moment of change cup, I closed my eyes, he smelled sweet wine.
sentences.chinese: 在换杯的那一刹那，我闭上眼就闻到了酒的香醇。

sentences.english: Suddenly, dizzy, flying sand and rolling pebbles, rampage.
sentences.chinese: 刹那间，天旋地转，飞沙走石，横冲直撞。

sentences.english: In the moment of full bloom, brilliant edge will abstract all sight light.
sentences.chinese: 在盛开的一刹那，灿烂夺目的它会吸引所有的视线。

sentences.english: There was a momentary silence, profound as what should follow the utterance of oracles.
sentences.chinese: 那一刹那的静穆，如同宣告了神谕之后一般深沉。

sentences.english: And this is going to sound like a weird topic, we're going to see why it's of value in a second.
sentences.chinese: 这听起来像个怪异的主题，我们将会去学习一刹那。

sentences.english: Hold infinity in the plain of your hand, And Eternity in on hour.
sentences.chinese: 把天空无尽握于手掌，永恒宁非是刹那时光。

definition: one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
(of a meteor etc) to streak across (the sky)/(of a searchlight, lightning etc) to play across (the sky)
